newsitem.title: USA: Novartis Corp gets first patent for genetic wheat.
newsitem.headline: Novartis Corp gets first patent for genetic wheat.

text.p: Novartis Corp, an affiliate of Novartis AG, said it received the first U.S. patent for production of genetically modified wheat.

The technology from the patent will be used to insert new genetic traits into wheat, such as resistance to disease or insects, of the kind already used to develop transgenic corn, soybeans, tomatoes and other crops, Novartis said.
Novartis said it plans to broadly license the intellectual property rights to the patent.

"This breakthrough will help research scientists develop new wheat plants with benefits for farmers, food processors and the environment," Edward T. Shonsey, president of Novartis Seeds Inc, said in a statement. (Chicago newsdesk 312 408 8720)
